recipes.name: Nutrient Powerhouse Breakfast Bowl
recipes.description: Pastured eggs, wild salmon, and greens for optimal morning nutrition
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat
Sauté spinach until wilted, about 2 minutes (reduces oxalates by 30%)
Cook eggs to your preference (scrambled, fried, or poached)
Plate eggs with spinach, salmon, and sliced avocado
Season with sea salt and pepper to taste

preparationNotes.antiNutrientReduction: Cooking spinach reduces oxalates by 30%, improving iron absorption. The vitamin C from remaining vegetables enhances iron bioavailability.
preparationNotes.bioavailabilityTips: The healthy fats from avocado and olive oil enhance absorption of fat-soluble vitamins A, D, E, and K. Heme iron from salmon is 3-5x more bioavailable than plant iron.
nutrientSynergies: Vitamin D from salmon + fat from avocado = optimal D absorption
Iron from spinach + vitamin C = 3x better iron absorption
Choline from eggs supports brain and liver function

recipes.name: Ancient Grain Berry Bowl with Nuts
recipes.description: Einkorn porridge with berries, walnuts, and grass-fed yogurt
instructions: Cook einkorn according to package directions (usually 20 min in boiling water)
Top with yogurt, blueberries, and chopped walnuts
Drizzle with raw honey if desired
Serve warm

recipes.name: Sardine Power Salad
recipes.description: Sardines with mixed greens, vegetables, and tahini dressing
instructions: Massage kale with lemon juice for 2-3 minutes until tender
Arrange kale on a plate
Top with sardines, shredded carrots, and roasted beets
Sprinkle pumpkin seeds on top
Drizzle with olive oil
Season with sea salt and black pepper

recipes.name: Grass-Fed Beef & Sweet Potato Bowl
recipes.description: Ground grass-fed beef with roasted vegetables and ancient grains
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)
Toss sweet potato cubes and Brussels sprouts with olive oil, season with salt
Roast vegetables for 25-30 minutes until caramelized
Steam broccoli for 5-7 minutes
Brown ground beef in a pan with minced garlic
Cook quinoa according to package directions
Assemble bowl with quinoa, beef, and all vegetables

recipes.name: Wild Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
recipes.description: Omega-3 rich salmon with seasonal vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)
Toss vegetables with 1 tbsp olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper
Roast vegetables for 20 minutes
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and lemon zest
Heat remaining olive oil in an oven-safe pan
Sear salmon skin-side down for 4 minutes
Flip and transfer pan to oven for 6-8 minutes
Serve salmon over roasted vegetables with lemon wedges

recipes.name: Brazil Nuts & Berries
recipes.description: Selenium-rich snack with antioxidants
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl
Enjoy immediately

recipes.name: Hard-Boiled Eggs with Veggie Sticks
recipes.description: Protein-rich snack with crunchy vegetables
instructions: Hard boil eggs (10 min in boiling water, then ice bath)
Peel and slice eggs
Cut vegetables into sticks
Sprinkle with sea salt
